dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A new U.S. consulate in Almaty, huh? I'm not sure how this really benefits Kazakhstan in the long run.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A new U.S. consulate in Almaty, huh? I'm not sure how this really benefits Kazakhstan in the long run.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, think about it—this isn't just a building. It's a 49-year lease on seven hectares of land, and the U.S. is paying over $25 million upfront.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, think about it-this isn't just a building. It's a forty nine-year lease on seven hectares of land, and the U.S. is paying over twenty five dollars million upfront.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States will lease a land plot in Almaty of approximately seven hectares (70,593 square meters) for a period of 49 years to build a new consulate building. The U.S. will pay $25.3 million in a single payment within 30 days after the agreement enters into force.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but they're getting tax exemptions and customs duty waivers too. That's a lot of lost revenue for Kazakhstan, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they're getting tax exemptions and customs duty waivers too. That's a lot of lost revenue for Kazakhstan, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under the agreement, the U.S. will not pay taxes or customs duties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but look at the bigger picture. This is gonna be the largest visa center in Central Asia—that's huge for regional influence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but look at the bigger picture. This is gonna be the largest visa center in Central Asia-that's huge for regional influence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the authors of the law, the new consulate will become the largest visa center in Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I guess, but what about the actual impact on locals? Are we sure this creates meaningful jobs or just temporary construction work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess, but what about the actual impact on locals? Are we sure this creates meaningful jobs or just temporary construction work?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, the deputy minister mentioned it'll support business and service sectors long-term. Plus, offices for the DEA and Commerce Department are moving in too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, the deputy minister mentioned it'll support business and service sectors long-term. Plus, offices for the D E A and Commerce Department are moving in too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the consulate, the site is expected to house offices of the U.S. Department of Commerce, the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), and the U.S. Commercial Service. This is expected to improve Kazakhstan's international image, attract investment, create jobs, and support the development of business and service sectors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, okay, but what about staffing? They're saying no immediate expansion, but then maybe later? Sounds vague.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, okay, but what about staffing? They're saying no immediate expansion, but then maybe later? Sounds vague.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As for plans to expand staff, I'm not aware of any, but given that the new facility will have a full range of infrastructure, some expansion can be expected. However, that's not certain " it will depend on discussions with the American side, said the deputy minister in the Senate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a fair point, but even relocating staff from those two privately leased buildings into one modern facility could streamline operations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a fair point, but even relocating staff from those two privately leased buildings into one modern facility could streamline operations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently, the U.S. consulate occupies two privately leased buildings in Almaty. Naturally, once the new consulate is built and opened, all staff will relocate there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And who's building it? A U.S. developer—so not exactly local contracts or expertise being prioritized.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And who's building it? A U.S. developer-so not exactly local contracts or expertise being prioritized.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Rakhmetullin, a U.S. developer will handle the project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a valid concern, but sometimes international standards require specialized firms. And hey, it might still create subcontracting opportunities locally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a valid concern, but sometimes international standards require specialized firms. And hey, it might still create subcontracting opportunities locally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe… I just hope it doesn't feel like another foreign outpost without real mutual benefit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe... I just hope it doesn't feel like another foreign outpost without real mutual benefit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I hear you, but strengthening U.S.-Kazakhstan relations and improving our intl image could attract more investment overall. It's a step.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I hear you, but strengthening U.S.-Kazakhstan relations and improving our intl image could attract more investment overall. It's a step.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is expected to improve Kazakhstan's international image, attract investment, create jobs, and support the development of business and service sectors. Once the agreement is officially finalized, it will strengthen trust with international partners and enhance U.S.-Kazakhstan relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, you've got me considering the upsides. Let's see how it plays out once construction starts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, you've got me considering the upsides. Let's see how it plays out once construction starts.
